title: Creating Windows XP Live USB with custom apps

forumNotes.author: Spaps
forumNotes.content:
Hello. I'm trying to create a Live USB of Windows XP with some custom apps on it, like HD Tune and such, for servicing PCs and laptops. It'd be run off a UFD, along with other stuff, like MemTest86+ and some antivirus boot ISOs. Everything is already hooked up in Grub4DOS, everything runs fine, I just need the WinXP live cd for it to be ready.

Could anybody help me with that? I'd like to make it just like Hiren's Boot CD but a bit smaller and custom, and what's the most important, in my own language. I have already seen threads about that, but every single one told to use BartPE, which doesn't really solve my problem, as I need to install my own applications into it.

Thanks in advance,

Spaps
